original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Paul says:_"Be renewed is the spirit of your mind, so that _

_you may put on the new man which was created according _

_to God, in true righteousness __and holiness." _(Eph. 4:23, 24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we decide to follow Christ we must put on a new nature,

head in a new direction, and have a new way of thinking, that

the Holy Spirit gives.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord for the day I decided to follow Christ,

BUT I still need Your Spirit's help each and every day so,

I pray that I will be sensitive and obedient to Your Spirit's

leading each day. Amen.
original_reflection_text: When we decide to follow Christ we must put on a new nature, head in a new direction, and have a new way of thinking, that the Holy Spirit gives.
original_verse_text: Paul says:"Be renewed is the spirit of your mind, so that you may put on the new man which was created according to God, in true righteousness and holiness."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to be transformed by the renewing of our minds. Help us to put off our old selves and be made new in the attitude of our minds, that we may clothe ourselves with the new self, created to be like You in true righteousness and holiness. Guide us, Lord, to walk in Your ways and align our thoughts with Your perfect will. May our lives be a reflection of Your grace and mercy. Amen.
reflection: When we decide to follow Christ, we must put on a new nature, head in a new direction, and have a new way of thinking that the Holy Spirit gives.
subject: Renewed Minds, Transformed Lives
verse_text: Paul says:“Be renewed is the spirit of your mind, so that you may put on the new man which was created according to God, in true righteousness and holiness.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be angry and do not sin," Do not let the sun go_

_down on your wrath, nor give place to the devil._

(Eph. 4:26, 27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Bible doesn't tell us we shouldn't feel anger, BUT IT

points out that it is important to handle our anger properly.

If we keep it inside, it can cause us to become bitter and

destroy us from within. Paul says to deal with our anger

immediately, in a way that builds relationships rather than

destroying them. Don't let the day end before you begin to

work on mending your relationship.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord, please forgive me, I am often guilty of bottling up

anger within. Help me to properly handle my anger toward

those who have ruffled my feathers so to speak. Help me

build a more compassionate spirit. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Bible doesn't tell us we shouldn't feel anger, BUT IT points out that it is important to handle our anger properly. If we keep it inside, it can cause us to become bitter and destroy us from within. Paul says to deal with our anger immediately, in a way that builds relationships rather than destroying them. Don't let the day end before you begin to work on mending your relationship.
original_verse_text: "Be angry and do not sin," Do not let the sun go down on your wrath, nor give place to the devil.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging the anger and bitterness that can so easily creep into our hearts. Help us to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry. Grant us the wisdom to address our grievances in a manner that honors You and preserves unity within the body of Christ. May we extend the same grace and forgiveness that You have so freely given to us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The Bible doesn't tell us we shouldn't feel anger, BUT IT points out that it is important to handle our anger properly. If we keep it inside, it can cause us to become bitter and destroy us from within. Paul says to deal with our anger immediately, in a way that builds relationships rather than destroying them. Don't let the day end before you begin to work on mending your relationship.
subject: Manage Anger, Mend Relationships
verse_text: “Be angry and do not sin,” Do not let the sun go down on your wrath, nor give place to the devil.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth,_

_but what is good for necessary edification. that it_

_may impart grace to the hearer." _(Eph. 4:29)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul warns against unwholesome language, bitterness,

improper use of anger, harsh words, slander, and bad

attitudes toward others. Instead we should be forgiving

just as God has forgiven us. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the words that I

speak would always be edifying and pleasing to You.

I pray this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen
original_reflection_text: Paul warns against unwholesome language, bitterness, improper use of anger, harsh words, slander, and bad attitudes toward others. Instead we should be forgiving just as God has forgiven us. .
original_verse_text: "Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth, but what is good for necessary edification. that it may impart grace to the hearer."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to walk in the way of Your Son. Help us to put on compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience, that we may bear with one another and forgive as You have forgiven us. May our speech be seasoned with grace, building up and encouraging one another, rather than tearing down. Empower us by Your Spirit to live in unity and love, that the world may see Your transforming power at work in our lives. Amen.
reflection: Paul warns against unwholesome language, bitterness, improper use of anger, harsh words, slander, and bad attitudes toward others. Instead, we should be forgiving, just as God has forgiven us.
subject: Speak with Gracious Words
verse_text: “Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth, but what is good for necessary edification. that it may impart grace to the hearer.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you _

_were sealed for the day of redemption." _(Eph. 4:30)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The presence of the Holy Spirit within us demonstrates

the genuineness of our faith, and proves that we are God's

children, and secures eternal life for us. The Spirit's power

works in us to transform us now, for that day of redemption.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the power of Your Spirit

will continue His work in my life so that I may become a

more faithful believer. Amen
original_reflection_text: The presence of the Holy Spirit within us demonstrates the genuineness of our faith, and proves that we are God's children, and secures eternal life for us. The Spirit's power works in us to transform us now, for that day of redemption.
original_verse_text: Do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of Your Holy Spirit, who dwells within us and bears witness that we are Your children (Romans 8:16-17). May we never grieve the Spirit by our actions, but rather walk in a manner worthy of our calling (Ephesians 4:30). Transform us daily by Your power, that we may be prepared for the day of our final redemption. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The presence of the Holy Spirit within us demonstrates the genuineness of our faith, and proves that we are God's children, and secures eternal life for us. The Spirit's power works in us to transform us now, for that day of redemption.
subject: Transformed by the Spirit's Power
verse_text: Do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.“

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil_

_speaking be put away from you, with all malice."_

(Eph. 4:31)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The main thought for every believer is to rid ourselves

of all evil practices and immorality. If we have made

such a commitment to Christ, are we remaining true to it?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Spirit would help me remain

true to my commitment, I pray this in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The main thought for every believer is to rid ourselves of all evil practices and immorality. If we have made such a commitment to Christ, are we remaining true to it?
original_verse_text: "Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil speaking be put away from you, with all malice."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to align our lives with Your perfect will. Help us to put to death the sinful desires that so easily entangle us—anger, wrath, malice, slander, and abusive language. Cleanse us from these vices, that we may clothe ourselves in the new self, renewed in knowledge after the image of our Creator. May our lives be a reflection of Your love and grace. Amen.
reflection: The main thought for every believer is to rid ourselves of all evil practices and immorality. If we have made such a commitment to Christ, are we remaining true to it?
subject: Rid Yourself of Evil
verse_text: “Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil speaking be put away from you, with all malice.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one _

_another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you."_

(Eph. 4:32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As we come to understand God's mercy we will want to

become like Him. Having received forgiveness we should

be willing to pass it on to others. Those who are unwilling

to forgive have NOT become one with Christ, who was willing

to forgive even those who crucified Him (Luke 23:34).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me for not always being as kind or

forgiving as I should be to others. I thank You for being

forgiving, because it was due to my sins You went to the

cross and died. Amen.
original_reflection_text: As we come to understand God's mercy we will want to become like Him. Having received forgiveness we should be willing to pass it on to others. Those who are unwilling to forgive have NOT become one with Christ, who was willing to forgive even those who crucified Him (Luke 23:34).
original_verse_text: "Be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, humbled by the boundless grace and forgiveness You have lavished upon us. Help us to clothe ourselves with compassion, kindness, and patience, just as You have done for us. Grant us the wisdom to forgive one another, even as You have forgiven us through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our lives reflect the transformative power of Your love, that we may be a light to those who need to experience Your mercy. Amen.
reflection: As we come to understand God's mercy, we will want to become like Him. Having received forgiveness, we should be willing to pass it on to others. Those who are unwilling to forgive have not become one with Christ, who was willing to forgive even those who crucified Him (Luke 23:34).
subject: Become Like God's Mercy
verse_text: “Be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Follow God's example in everything you do, because you are _

_God's dear children." _(Eph. 5:1))

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"Follow Gods example:" _This raises a great question. How can

we be perfect? Lets look at 4 areas in which we need to grow:

_(1) character_ _ (2) holiness (3) maturity_ (4) _love _Now we can

_be perfect, if our behavior is appropriate for our maturity
level--yet _

with room to grow. Our tendency to sin MUST NEVER deter us from

trying to become more like Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I pray that I would be submissive to Your Holy Spirit's

guidance so that I might grow in character, holiness, maturity, and

love, helping me to become more like Christ. Amen
original_reflection_text: "Follow Gods example:" This raises a great question. How can we be perfect? Lets look at 4 areas in which we need to grow: (1) character (2) holiness (3) maturity (4) love Now we can be perfect, if our behavior is appropriate for our maturity level--yet with room to grow. Our tendency to sin MUST NEVER deter us from trying to become more like Christ.
original_verse_text: "Follow God's example in everything you do, because you are God's dear children."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to follow Your example and the example of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to cultivate a character that reflects Your holiness and love. May we grow in maturity, putting aside our sinful tendencies and striving to become more like Christ, who humbled Himself and became obedient to the point of death on the cross. Guide us, Lord, as we seek to walk in Your ways and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: “Follow God's example.” This raises a great question. How can we be perfect? Let's look at 4 areas in which we need to grow: (1) character (2) holiness (3) maturity (4) love. Now we can be perfect, if our behavior is appropriate for our maturity level—yet with room to grow. Our tendency to sin must never deter us from trying to become more like Christ.
subject: Grow in God's Likeness
verse_text: “Follow God's example in everything you do, because you are God's dear children.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Live a life filled with love for others, following the example of
Christ _

_who loved you and gave His life as a sacrifice to take away your
sins." _

(Eph. 5:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are to love others based on Jesus' sacrificial love for us. such
love

will not only bring unbelievers to Christ, it will also keep
believers

strong and united in a world hostile to God. Jesus was a living
example

of God's love, as we are to be an example of Jesus' love.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of love, grace, and mercy, I thank You for Your love which

caused You to sacrifice Your one and only son, that I might have

eternal life. I pray that my life would become an example of Your

love. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We are to love others based on Jesus' sacrificial love for us. such love will not only bring unbelievers to Christ, it will also keep believers strong and united in a world hostile to God. Jesus was a living example of God's love, as we are to be an example of Jesus' love.
original_verse_text: "Live a life filled with love for others, following the example of Christ who loved you and gave His life as a sacrifice to take away your sins."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the sacrificial love of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who loved us and gave Himself up for us as a fragrant offering and sacrifice to You. Help us to love one another with genuine affection, outdo one another in showing honor, and reflect the love of Christ in our relationships. May our love for one another be sincere, so that the world may see Your love through us and be drawn to You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: We are to love others based on Jesus' sacrificial love for us. Such love will not only bring unbelievers to Christ, it will also keep believers strong and united in a world hostile to God. Jesus was a living example of God's love, as we are to be an example of Jesus' love.
subject: Sacrificial Love Transforms Lives
verse_text: “Live a life filled with love for others, following the example of Christ who loved you and gave His life as a sacrifice to take away your sins.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Let there be no sexual immorality, impurity, or greed be found _

_among you. Such sins have no place among God's people." _(Eph. 5:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We should consider ourselves dead to sexual immorality, impurity,

or greed. We must make a conscious, decision each day to remove

anything that supports or feeds these desires. To do this we must

rely on the Holy Spirit's power.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, once again I have to plead with You

for the guidance of Your Holy Spirit's power to help me to

avoid the sins of immorality, impurity, and greed. I ask this

in the name of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We should consider ourselves dead to sexual immorality, impurity, or greed. We must make a conscious, decision each day to remove anything that supports or feeds these desires. To do this we must rely on the Holy Spirit's power.
original_verse_text: "Let there be no sexual immorality, impurity, or greed be found among you. Such sins have no place among God's people."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our need for Your strength and guidance. Help us to consider ourselves dead to the temptations of sexual immorality, impurity, and greed, as Your Word instructs. Grant us the wisdom and discernment to remove anything from our lives that would feed these sinful desires. May we rely on the power of Your Holy Spirit to walk in holiness and righteousness, honoring You in all we do. Amen.
reflection: We should consider ourselves dead to sexual immorality, impurity, or greed. We must make a conscious decision each day to remove anything that supports or feeds these desires. To do this, we must rely on the Holy Spirit's power.
subject: Overcome Impurity Through Spirit's Power
verse_text: “Let there be no sexual immorality, impurity, or greed be found among you. Such sins have no place among God's people.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Paul says _"you can be sure that no immoral, impure, or greedy_

_person will inherit the Kingdom of Christ and God. For a greedy_

_person is really an idolater who worships the things of this world."
_

(Eph. 5:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christians come out of all kinds of different back-grounds including
these

just mentioned. They may struggle with evil desires, but they should
not

continue in these practices. In I Cor. 6:11 Paul clearly states that
even those

who sin in these ways can have their lives changed by Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I point my finger at those

who live in sin openly, for I know that in Your eyes I am a sinner

only saved by Your grace. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: Christians come out of all kinds of different backgrounds including these just mentioned. They may struggle with evil desires, but they should not continue in these practices. In I Corinthians 6:11 Paul clearly states that even those who sin in these ways can have their lives changed by Christ.
original_verse_text: Paul says"you can be sure that no immoral, impure, or greedy person will inherit the Kingdom of Christ and God. For a greedy person is really an idolater who worships the things of this world."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging the sinful desires that can so easily entangle us. Yet, we are grateful that through Your Son, Jesus Christ, we can be transformed and set free from the bondage of sin. Help us to walk in the light, putting off the deeds of darkness and living as children of the day. May our lives be a testament to Your redeeming power and the new life we have in You. Amen.
reflection: Christians come out of all kinds of different backgrounds, including those just mentioned. They may struggle with evil desires, but they should not continue in these practices. In 1 Corinthians 6:11, Paul clearly states that even those who sin in these ways can have their lives changed by Christ.
subject: Transformed by Christ's Power
verse_text: Paul says“you can be sure that no immoral, impure, or greedy person will inherit the Kingdom of Christ and God. For a greedy person is really an idolater who worships the things of this world.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"_Don't be fooled by those who try to excuse these sins; _

(immorality, impurity, greed) _for the terrible anger of God comes_

_upon those who disobey." _(Eph. 5:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God cannot tolerate sin because His nature is morally perfect. He

cannot ignore or condone willful rebellion. God wants to remove

the sin and restore the sinner, and He is able to, as long as the
sinner

does not stubbornly distort or reject the truth. Don't suppress the
truth

about Him merely to protect your own life style.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would never fall prey to the

sins of immorality, impurity, or greed. But I know that I am a

sinner saved only by Your Grace. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God cannot tolerate sin because His nature is morally perfect. He cannot ignore or condone willful rebellion. God wants to remove the sin and restore the sinner, and He is able to, as long as the sinner does not stubbornly distort or reject the truth. Don't suppress the truth about Him merely to protect your own life style.
original_verse_text: "Don't be fooled by those who try to excuse these sins; (immorality, impurity, greed) for the terrible anger of God comes upon those who disobey."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the gravity of our sin and the danger of willfully rejecting the truth. Your holiness demands that You cannot overlook our rebellion, for You are a God of perfect righteousness. Yet, in Your great love, You desire to remove our sin and restore us to Yourself. Help us, Lord, to not suppress the truth about You, but to submit to Your will and walk in obedience. May we never take Your grace for granted, but cling to the salvation offered through Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: God cannot tolerate sin because His nature is morally perfect. He cannot ignore or condone willful rebellion. God wants to remove the sin and restore the sinner, and He is able to, as long as the sinner does not stubbornly distort or reject the truth. Don't suppress the truth about Him merely to protect your own lifestyle.
subject: Embrace God's Moral Perfection
verse_text: “Don't be fooled by those who try to excuse these sins; (immorality, impurity, greed) for the terrible anger of God comes upon those who disobey.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Though your hearts were once full of darkness, now you are _

_full of light from the Lord and your behavior should show it."_

(Eph. 5:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As people filled with light, our actions should reflect our faith.

We should live beyond reproach morally so that we will reflect

God's goodness to others. Jesus stressed this truth in the Sermon

on the Mount. (Mt. 5:15, 16)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that my behavior would be pleasing to You.

I pray that my behavior would always reflect my faith, and that

it would always reflect Your goodness to others. Amen
original_reflection_text: As people filled with light, our actions should reflect our faith. We should live beyond reproach morally so that we will reflect God's goodness to others. Jesus stressed this truth in the Sermon on the Mount. (Matthew 5:15, 16)
original_verse_text: "Though your hearts were once full of darkness, now you are full of light from the Lord and your behavior should show it."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for calling us out of darkness and into Your marvelous light. Help us to live as children of light, reflecting Your goodness and truth in all we do. May our lives be a shining example that leads others to glorify You. Guide us to walk in a manner worthy of the gospel, that Your name may be exalted. Amen.
reflection: As people filled with light, our actions should reflect our faith. We should live beyond reproach morally so that we will reflect God's goodness to others. Jesus stressed this truth in the Sermon on the Mount. (Matthew 5:15, 16)
subject: Reflect God's Goodness to Others
verse_text: “Though your hearts were once full of darkness, now you are full of light from the Lord and your behavior should show it.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_" Take no part in worthless deeds OF evil AND darkness,_

_instead, rebuke and expose them." _(Eph. 5;11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is important to AVOID worthless deeds of evil, but we are

to go further, Paul says we are to EXPOSE THEM, because our

silence may be interpreted as approval. God needs people

who will take a stand.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be ready

to be a witness for You, and that I would always be ready

to defend Your name. I pray these things in Jesus name. Amen
original_reflection_text: It is important to AVOID worthless deeds of evil, but we are to go further, Paul says we are to EXPOSE THEM, because our silence may be interpreted as approval. God needs people who will take a stand.
original_verse_text: "Have nothing to do with the fruitless deeds of darkness, but rather expose them."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your guidance and strength. Help us to discern the worthless deeds of evil and have the courage to expose them, for our silence may be seen as approval. Grant us the wisdom to walk in the light, shining Your truth and love in a world that desperately needs it. May we be bold witnesses for Your kingdom, standing firm against the darkness. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: It is important to AVOID worthless deeds of evil, but we are to go further, Paul says we are to EXPOSE THEM, because our silence may be interpreted as approval. God needs people who will take a stand.
subject: Expose Worthless Deeds of Evil
verse_text: “Have nothing to do with the fruitless deeds of darkness, but rather expose them.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be careful how you live, not as fools, but as those who are wise. _

_Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil _

_days. _(Eph. 5:15, 16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

You would almost think Paul had been listening to CNN.

We surely are living in evil days. We need to be careful to

keep our standards high, and do good wherever we can, BUT

we also need to be wise and keep our focus on our Savior,

who came to pay for the sins of the whole world.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, You know better then we that we do

live in evil days. I thank You, for providing for us a Savior

who willing paid the penalty for my sins. .Amen
original_reflection_text: You would almost think Paul had been listening to CNN. We surely are living in evil days. We need to be careful to keep our standards high, and do good wherever we can, BUT we also need to be wise and keep our focus on our Savior, who came to pay for the sins of the whole world.
original_verse_text: "Be careful how you live, not as fools, but as those who are wise. Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil days.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in these perilous times, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to walk carefully, not as unwise but as wise, redeeming the time, for the days are evil. Strengthen us to not be conformed to this world, but to be transformed by the renewing of our minds, that we may discern Your good, acceptable, and perfect will. May our lives be a reflection of Your love and grace to a world in need of a Savior. Amen.
reflection: You would almost think Paul had been listening to CNN. We surely are living in evil days. We need to be careful to keep our standards high, and do good wherever we can, but we also need to be wise and keep our focus on our Savior, who came to pay for the sins of the whole world.
subject: Shine Brightly in Dark Days
verse_text: “Be careful how you live, not as fools, but as those who are wise. Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil days.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Don't act thoughtlessly, try to understand what the _

_Lord wants you to do." _(Eph. 5:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Being made holy is the process of living the Christian life.

It is part of the Holy Spirit work in us conforming us to the

image of Christ. (Ro. 8:29)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, forgive me for not always being in

tune with Your Spirit's leading. I pray that I would become

more sensitive to Your Spirit attempting to conform me into

the image of Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Being made holy is the process of living the Christian life. It is part of the Holy Spirit work in us conforming us to the image of Christ. (Romans 8:29)
original_verse_text: "Don't act thoughtlessly, try to understand what the Lord wants you to do."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, desiring to be transformed by the renewing of our minds. Help us to discern Your good, pleasing, and perfect will, and to live in a way that is holy and pleasing to You. May we offer our bodies as living sacrifices, set apart for Your service. Guide us, Lord, as we seek to be conformed to the image of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Being made holy is the process of living the Christian life. It is part of the Holy Spirit's work in us, conforming us to the image of Christ. (Romans 8:29)
subject: Becoming Holy Through Christ
verse_text: “Don't act thoughtlessly, try to understand what the Lord wants you to do.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"SUBMIT TO ONE ANOTHER OUT OF REVERENCE TO CHRIST."_

(Ephesians 5:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Submitting to another person is often a misunderstood concept.

It does not mean becoming a door mat. Christ at whose Name

_"every knee will bow, in heaven and on earth and under the_

_earth_" (Phil. 2:10)...submitted His will to the Father, and we

honor Christ, by following His example. When we submit to

God, we become more willing to obey His command to submit

to others.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would have a more submissive

spirit, so that I would develop a more Christ-like image. I pray

that I would become more sensitive to Your Spirit's leading, so

that I would be open to Your every command. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Submitting to another person is often a misunderstood concept. It does not mean becoming a door mat. Christ at whose Name"every knee will bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth" (Philippians 2:10). submitted His will to the Father, and we honor Christ, by following His example. When we submit to God, we become more willing to obey His command to submit to others.
original_verse_text: "SUBMIT TO ONE ANOTHER OUT OF REVERENCE TO CHRIST."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to emulate the example of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to have the same mindset as He did, willing to submit our will to Yours and to one another in love. May we find the strength to let go of our pride and self-interest, and instead, embrace the path of servanthood and sacrifice, just as Christ did for us. Guide us, Lord, to walk in the footsteps of our Savior, that we may honor You and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Submitting to another person is often a misunderstood concept. It does not mean becoming a doormat. Christ, at whose name “every knee will bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth” (Philippians 2:10), submitted His will to the Father, and we honor Christ by following His example. When we submit to God, we become more willing to obey His command to submit to others.
subject: Submitting to God Leads to Obedience
verse_text: “SUBMIT TO ONE ANOTHER OUT OF REVERENCE TO CHRIST.”

original_content:
VERSES FOR TODAY:

(Eph. 5:22-32) What is being said in these verses is:"Husband and

wives should have a Spirit-guided relations." Paul sums up what is

said in these verses in Vs. 33: _"So again I say, each man must love
_

_his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her
husband."_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you read all the verses, what you should surmise is that you
should

care for your spouse as you care for yourself, learning to anticipate
his

or her needs, helping them to become all that they can be.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be in tune with Your Spirit's

guidance so that my relationship with my wife and others would be

one of love and respect.. Amen.
original_reflection_text: If you read all the verses, what you should surmise is that you should care for your spouse as you care for yourself, learning to anticipate his or her needs, helping them to become all that they can be.
original_verse_text: However, each one of you also must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance in our marriages. Help us to love our spouses as Christ loved the church, sacrificing ourselves for their well-being and nurturing them to become all that You have called them to be. Grant us the humility to put our spouse's needs before our own, that our love may reflect the profound mystery of Christ's love for His bride. May our marriages be a testament to Your unending grace and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: If you read all the verses, what you should surmise is that you should care for your spouse as you care for yourself, learning to anticipate their needs, helping them to become all that they can be.
subject: Nurture Your Spouse's Growth
verse_text: However, each one of you also must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Honor Your father and mother. This is the first of the _

_commandments, that ends with a promise,"_ ((Eph. 6:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There is a difference between obeying and honoring. To

obey, means to do what one is told; to honor means to

respect and love. Children are to obey while under their

parent's care, but the responsibility to honor parents is

for life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for the good example my parents set for me.

I pray that my life would be a good example for my family

members to follow. Amen
original_reflection_text: There is a difference between obeying and honoring. To obey, means to do what one is told; to honor means to respect and love. Children are to obey while under their parent's care, but the responsibility to honor parents is for life.
original_verse_text: "Honor Your father and mother. This is the first of the commandments, that ends with a promise,"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of family and the wisdom You have imparted to us through the words of Scripture. Help us to not merely obey our parents, but to truly honor them with reverence and love, recognizing the blessing they are in our lives. May we heed the instruction of Your Word and wear the adornment of honor as a crown of splendor. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: There is a difference between obeying and honoring. To obey means to do what one is told; to honor means to respect and love. Children are to obey while under their parents' care, but the responsibility to honor parents is for life.
subject: Honoring Parents for Life
verse_text: “Honor Your father and mother. This is the first of the commandments, that ends with a promise,”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The promise for honoring your father and mother. you will live a
long _

_life, full of blessings." _(Eph. 6:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Obeying our parents is our main task when we are young, but honoring

should continue even beyond their death. One way to honor our parents

is to provide for them in times of financial need or when they are
unable

to care for themselves.One of the best ways to honor them is to pass
on

their godly values to our children. (Question) Are you truly living
in a

way that brings honor to your parents?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me by the power of Your Holy Spirit to
honor

my parents as Christ honored You by fulfilling Your will while He
walked

this earth, even to the point of suffering for the sins of the world.
Help me

to mirror the godly values of my parents to my children.. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Obeying our parents is our main task when we are young, but honoring should continue even beyond their death. One way to honor our parents is to provide for them in times of financial need or when they are unable to care for themselves. One of the best ways to honor them is to pass on their godly values to our children. (Question) Are you truly living in a way that brings honor to your parents?
original_verse_text: "The promise for honoring your father and mother. you will live a long life, full of blessings."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of parents who have nurtured and guided us. Help us to honor them not only in our youth, but throughout our lives, by providing for their needs and passing on the godly values they have instilled in us. May our lives be a testament to the wisdom and faithfulness they have shared. Grant us the wisdom to live in a way that brings glory to You and honor to our parents. Amen.
reflection: Obeying our parents is our main task when we are young, but honoring should continue even beyond their death. One way to honor our parents is to provide for them in times of financial need or when they are unable to care for themselves. One of the best ways to honor them is to pass on their godly values to our children. Are you truly living in a way that brings honor to your parents?
subject: Honoring Parents Beyond Death
verse_text: “The promise for honoring your father and mother. you will live a long life, full of blessings.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"And now a word to you fathers. Don't make your children_

_angry by the way you treat them. _(Eph. 6:4a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christian parents and Christian children will relate to each other

with thoughtfulness and love. This will happen if both parents

and children put the others' interests ahead of their own.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the many gifts and

blessing You have given us especially our children.

Keep them safe and healthy I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Christian parents and Christian children will relate to each other with thoughtfulness and love. This will happen if both parents and children put the others' interests ahead of their own.
original_verse_text: And now a word to you fathers. Don't make your children angry by the way you treat them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the wisdom found in Your Word. Help us, as Christian families, to embody the selfless love that You have shown us. May we put the needs and interests of our loved ones before our own, cultivating an environment of mutual care and respect. Guide us to raise our children in the knowledge and admonition of the Lord, that they may grow to honor You in all they do. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Christian parents and Christian children will relate to each other with thoughtfulness and love. This will happen if both parents and children put the others' interests ahead of their own.
subject: Thoughtful, Loving Relationships Between Parents and Children
verse_text: And now a word to you fathers. Don't make your children angry by the way you treat them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be strong with the Lord's mighty power." _(Eph. 6:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In the Christian life we battle against rulers and authorities (the
powerful

evil forces of fallen angels headed by Satan, who is a vicious
fighter, see

I Pet. 5:8). To withstand their attacks we must depend on God's
strength.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, it is so easy to get caught up in the activities of this
world and

forget to look to You each morning for Your guidance. I need Your
Spirit's

power to keep from falling into Satan's traps. Amen
original_reflection_text: In the Christian life we battle against rulers and authorities (the powerful evil forces of fallen angels headed by Satan, who is a vicious fighter, see I Peter 5:8). To withstand their attacks we must depend on God's strength.
original_verse_text: "Be strong with the Lord's mighty power."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, recognizing the spiritual battles we face in this world. Grant us the strength and courage to stand firm against the schemes of the devil and the powers of this dark age. May we find our refuge in Your mighty power, trusting that if You are for us, who can be against us? Equip us with Your full armor, that we may withstand the evil day and, having done all, to stand. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: In the Christian life, we battle against rulers and authorities (the powerful evil forces of fallen angels headed by Satan, who is a vicious fighter, see 1 Peter 5:8). To withstand their attacks, we must depend on God's strength.
subject: Depend on God's Strength
verse_text: “Be strong with the Lord's mighty power.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Stand your ground, putting on the sturdy belt of truth _

_and the body armor of God's righteousness." _ (Eph. 6:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our nation desperately needs a revival of righteousness and

justice for the oppressed. The righteousness that God values

is more then refraining from sin. We need to fight in the strength

of the church, where power comes from the Holy Spirit.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that a good old fashioned revival

would happen in our nation. It is so easy for us, myself include

to point our figure at others, but we all have enough sins in our

lives to deserve Your wrath. May I allow a revival to begin in

my heart. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Our nation desperately needs a revival of righteousness and justice for the oppressed. The righteousness that God values is more then refraining from sin. We need to fight in the strength of the church, where power comes from the Holy Spirit.
original_verse_text: "Stand your ground, putting on the sturdy belt of truth and the body armor of God's righteousness."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our need for a revival of righteousness and justice in our nation. Grant us the strength and wisdom to walk humbly with You, to act justly, and to love mercy, as Your prophet Micah has called us to do. Empower us, through the might of Your Holy Spirit, to stand firm in the truth of Your Word and to be a light in the darkness, fighting for the oppressed and the marginalized. May Your righteousness and justice reign in our land. Amen.
reflection: Our nation desperately needs a revival of righteousness and justice for the oppressed. The righteousness that God values is more than refraining from sin. We need to fight in the strength of the church, where power comes from the Holy Spirit.
subject: Revive Righteousness and Justice
verse_text: “Stand your ground, putting on the sturdy belt of truth and the body armor of God's righteousness.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News,_

_so that you will be fully prepared." _(Eph. 6:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God says that the feet those who bring good news, are

"beautiful." It is a wonderful privilege to be able to share

God's Good News with others, His news of redemption,

salvation, and peace. To whom do you need to share the

Good News.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the privilege I have had

to share The"Good News." I pray that You would forgive me

for not ALWAYS fulfilling that privilege as I should. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God says that the feet those who bring good news, are"beautiful." It is a wonderful privilege to be able to share God's Good News with others, His news of redemption, salvation, and peace. To whom do you need to share the Good News.
original_verse_text: "For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News, so that you will be fully prepared."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the privilege of sharing the Good News of Your salvation and the peace that comes through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Give us the courage and boldness to proclaim the message of redemption, that our feet may be considered beautiful in Your sight. May we be faithful messengers, bringing the light of Your truth to those who walk in darkness. We ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus. Amen.
reflection: God says that the feet of those who bring good news are “beautiful.” It is a wonderful privilege to be able to share God's Good News with others, His news of redemption, salvation, and peace. To whom do you need to share the Good News?
subject: Sharing God's Beautiful News
verse_text: “For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News, so that you will be fully prepared.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"In every battle you will need faith as your shield to stop_

_the fiery arrows aimed at you by Satin." _(Eph. 6:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus never promised that obeying Him would be easy.

But the hard work and self-discipline of serving Christ

is no burden to those who love Him. And if our load starts

to feel heavy, we can always trust Christ to help us bear it.

(see Mt. 11:28-30)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for always being available to

come to our aid when confronted by Satan's attacks.

Forgive me for stumbling down the road of life and

not always seeking Your help. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Jesus never promised that obeying Him would be easy. But the hard work and self-discipline of serving Christ is no burden to those who love Him. And if our load starts to feel heavy, we can always trust Christ to help us bear it. (see Matthew 11:28-30)
original_verse_text: "In every battle you will need faith as your shield to stop the fiery arrows aimed at you by Satin."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You weary and burdened, seeking Your rest and restoration. Help us to take up Your yoke, for it is easy, and to bear Your burden, for it is light. Strengthen us with the shield of faith, that we may stand firm against the attacks of the enemy. May we find true peace and refreshment in Your presence, as we labor faithfully in Your service. We trust in Your promise to give us rest for our souls. Amen.
reflection: Jesus never promised that obeying Him would be easy. But the hard work and self-discipline of serving Christ is no burden to those who love Him. And if our load starts to feel heavy, we can always trust Christ to help us bear it. (see Matthew 11:28-30)
subject: Bearing Christ's Light Joyfully
verse_text: “In every battle you will need faith as your shield to stop the fiery arrows aimed at you by Satin.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Pray at all time and on every occasion, in the power of the _

_Holy Spirit.Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for _

_all Christians everywhere." _(Eph. 6:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I've had students ask me how you can pray at all times?

One way is to0 make quick, brief prayers your habit to

every situation. Another ways is to order your life around

God's desire and teaching, so that your life so that your very

life becomes a prayer. You can make prayer your life, and

your life a prayer.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I pray for Your forgiveness for my negligence in not living a

life of prayer as I should. But today I want to remember

Christian Churches around the world. Amen.
original_reflection_text: I've had students ask me how you can pray at all times? One way is to0 make quick, brief prayers your habit to every situation. Another ways is to order your life around God's desire and teaching, so that your life so that your very life becomes a prayer. You can make prayer your life, and your life a prayer.
original_verse_text: "Pray at all time and on every occasion, in the power of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all Christians everywhere."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You are the source of our strength and hope. Help us to be steadfast in prayer, persevering through all circumstances, and finding joy in the knowledge that You are always with us. May our lives be a living testament to Your goodness, as we strive to make our every thought and action a reflection of Your will. We trust in Your perfect plan and seek to walk in Your ways. Amen.
reflection: I've had students ask me how you can pray at all times? One way is to make quick, brief prayers your habit to every situation. Another way is to order your life around God's desire and teaching, so that your very life becomes a prayer. You can make prayer your life, and your life a prayer.
subject: Pray Without Ceasing
verse_text: “Pray at all time and on every occasion, in the power of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all Christians everywhere.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_" May God give you peace, dear brothers and sisters, and love with
faith,_

_from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ." _(Eph. 6:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are encouraged to continue living responsibly in spite of critical

circumstances. Christ's return is more then doctrine, IT IS A
PROMISE!

It is not just for the future, it has a vital impact on how we live
now!

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, help me to persevere in confident expectation

that I am not alone or forgotten. Help me never forget Your

promise that You would never abandon me. Amen..
original_reflection_text: We are encouraged to continue living responsibly in spite of critical circumstances. Christ's return is more then doctrine, IT IS A PROMISE! It is not just for the future, it has a vital impact on how we live now!
original_verse_text: "May God give you peace, dear brothers and sisters, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ."
prayer: Gracious Heavenly Father, we come before you with grateful hearts, acknowledging your sovereignty and the promise of Christ's return. Help us to live with diligence and vigilance, ever mindful of the urgency of the times. May we be found faithful, walking in the light, and ready to welcome our Savior when he comes. We pray this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord and Redeemer. Amen.
reflection: We are encouraged to continue living responsibly in spite of critical circumstances. Christ's return is more than doctrine, IT IS A PROMISE! It is not just for the future, it has a vital impact on how we live now!
subject: Responsible Living Amid Challenges
verse_text: “May God give you peace, dear brothers and sisters, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I always pray for you, and I make my requests with a heart full of
joy," _

(Phil. 1:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul was sharing his feelings toward all believers in Philippi.

(Here are some personal thoughts to ask yourself)

When others think about you, what comes to their minds?

Are you remembered with joy by them? Do your acts of

kindness lift up others?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord of grace and mercy, I pray that my acts of kindness

would always be remembered with joy by others. I pray that my

acts of kindness would lift others up. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Paul was sharing his feelings toward all believers in Philippi. (Here are some personal thoughts to ask yourself) When others think about you, what comes to their minds? Are you remembered with joy by them? Do your acts of kindness lift up others?
original_verse_text: "I always pray for you, and I make my requests with a heart full of joy"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of fellowship with one another in Christ. Help us to love one another sincerely, to outdo one another in showing honor, and to rejoice with those who rejoice. May our lives be a reflection of Your love, that others may see Your goodness in us and be drawn to You. Fill us with the joy of Your presence, that we may encourage and uplift all who cross our paths. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Paul was sharing his feelings toward all believers in Philippi. When others think about you, what comes to their minds? Are you remembered with joy by them? Do your acts of kindness lift up others?
subject: Remembered with Joy and Kindness
verse_text: “I always pray for you, and I make my requests with a heart full of joy”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"You have been my partners in spreading the Good News about _

_Christ from the time you first believe until now." _(Phil. 1:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul was thankful for the Philippian's contribution in the spreading

of God's message through their financial support. As we help our

ministers, missionaries, and evangelists through prayer, hospitality,

and financial gifts, we become partners with them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be faithful in

spreading God's message of eternal life. Help me remember to

pray for our ministers, missionaries, and evangelists. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Paul was thankful for the Philippians's contribution in the spreading of God's message through their financial support. As we help our ministers, missionaries, and evangelists through prayer, hospitality, and financial gifts, we become partners with them.
original_verse_text: "You have been my partners in spreading the Good News about Christ from the time you first believe until now."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you with grateful hearts for the opportunity to partner with those who faithfully proclaim your gospel. May we be generous in our support, both financially and through our prayers, that your message may continue to spread and transform lives. Guide us, Lord, to be faithful stewards of the resources you have entrusted to us, that we may glorify your name. Amen.
reflection: Paul was thankful for the Philippians' contribution in the spreading of God's message through their financial support. As we help our ministers, missionaries, and evangelists through prayer, hospitality, and financial gifts, we become partners with them.
subject: Partnering in God's Mission
verse_text: “You have been my partners in spreading the Good News about Christ from the time you first believe until now.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I am sure that God, who began a good work within you, will continue
_

_His work until it is finally finished on that day when Jesus comes
back _

_again." _(Phil. 1:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Do you sometimes feel as I do, that you aren't making any progress in

your spiritual life?_ _ Scriptures tell us that when God starts a
project, He

completes it! As with the Philippians, Scriptures also tells us God
will

help us grow in grace until He has completed His work in our life.
When

we become discouraged, let us pray for patience and remember that God

HAS promised He will complete the work He has begun in us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I become discouraged with my

spiritual growth I know You have promised to finish the work You have

begun. Forgive me for my lack of patience. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: Do you sometimes feel as I do, that you aren't making any progress in your spiritual life? Scriptures tell us that when God starts a project, He completes it! As with the Philippians, Scriptures also tells us God will help us grow in grace until He has completed His work in our life. When we become discouraged, let us pray for patience and remember that God HAS promised He will complete the work He has begun in us.
original_verse_text: "I am sure that God, who began a good work within you, will continue His work until it is finally finished on that day when Jesus comes back again."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that the work of transformation in our lives is Yours alone. Like the Philippians, we trust that You who have begun a good work in us will bring it to completion. When we grow weary or discouraged, grant us patience and perseverance, that we may fix our eyes on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith. Empower us by Your Spirit to press on toward the goal, confident that You will complete the work You have started. Amen.
reflection: Do you sometimes feel as I do, that you aren't making any progress in your spiritual life? Scriptures tell us that when God starts a project, He completes it! As with the Philippians, Scripture also tells us God will help us grow in grace until He has completed His work in our life. When we become discouraged, let us pray for patience and remember that God has promised He will complete the work He has begun in us.
subject: Trusting God's Faithful Completion
verse_text: “I am sure that God, who began a good work within you, will continue His work until it is finally finished on that day when Jesus comes back again.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I pray that your love for each other will overflow more _

_and more, and that you will keep growing in your knowledge_

_ and __understanding." _(Phil. 1:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Often the best way to influence someone is to pray for them.

Paul's prayer for the Philippians was that they would be unified

in love. Their love was to result in a greater knowledge of Christ

and s deeper moral discernment.. As we grow in Christ's love, our

heart and mind must grow together.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess that it is easy to

fall into the trap of praying only for family needs. I pray

that you would enlighten me in the needs of others

especially the less fortunate. I pray now for our ministers,

missionaries, and evangelists. I pray that our country's

leaders would grow in a deeper moral discernment. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Often the best way to influence someone is to pray for them. Paul's prayer for the Philippians was that they would be unified in love. Their love was to result in a greater knowledge of Christ and s deeper moral discernment. As we grow in Christ's love, our heart and mind must grow together.
original_verse_text: "I pray that your love for each other will overflow more and more, and that you will keep growing in your knowledge and understanding."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking Your guidance and wisdom. May our love for one another be sincere and unwavering, growing deeper in our knowledge and discernment of Christ. Help us to live out the unity and devotion that You have called us to, that we may bring glory to Your name. Lord, fill us with Your love, that it may overflow and touch the lives of those around us. Amen.
reflection: Often the best way to influence someone is to pray for them. Paul's prayer for the Philippians was that they would be unified in love. Their love was to result in a greater knowledge of Christ and s deeper moral discernment. As we grow in Christ's love, our heart and mind must grow together.
subject: Unified in Christ's Love
verse_text: “I pray that your love for each other will overflow more and more, and that you will keep growing in your knowledge and understanding.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may_

_live pure and blameless lives until Christ returns:" _(Phil. 1:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul prayed that the Philippian believers would have the ability

to differentiate between right and wrong, good and bad, vial

and trivial. We ought to pray for discernment so we can maintain

our Christian morals and values. (Heb. 5:14) We should live each

day as though Christ might return at any moment.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of all creation, create now in me a discernment to always

be able to maintain true Christian morals and values. Help me

live each day as if Christ were to return any moment. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Paul prayed that the Philippians believers would have the ability to differentiate between right and wrong, good and bad, vial and trivial. We ought to pray for discernment so we can maintain our Christian morals and values. (Hebrews 5:14) We should live each day as though Christ might return at any moment.
original_verse_text: "I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may live pure and blameless lives until Christ returns:"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your wisdom and discernment. Grant us the ability to distinguish between what is right and wrong, good and bad, so that we may live our lives in a manner that honors You. Help us to be vigilant, making the most of every opportunity, for the days are evil. May we walk with care, not as unwise but as wise, always seeking to do Your will. We pray that our lives may be a testament to Your love and grace. Amen.
reflection: Paul prayed that the Philippian believers would have the ability to differentiate between right and wrong, good and bad, vital and trivial. We ought to pray for discernment so we can maintain our Christian morals and values. (Hebrews 5:14) We should live each day as though Christ might return at any moment.
subject: Discern Good from Bad
verse_text: “I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may live pure and blameless lives until Christ returns:”
